intro.heading: Your Link to Entertainment and Everyday Help
intro.paragraph: Whether you're fixing a car in a parking lot, catching a movie in an airport lounge or just unwinding after work, your EPL card keeps you connected. Access practical guides, stream movies and TV shows, read eBooks or explore new hobbies. Wherever you are, EPL is your digital companion for learning, entertainment and everyday life.

access.heading: No Subscriptions Needed!
access.paragraph: Your EPL card is your key to a world of digital content, available anytime, anywhere. Last year, Edmontonians borrowed 11 million items using their library card. With your card, you can:
list: Stream movies, TV shows, and music without extra subscription fees.
Download bestselling eBooks and audiobooks directly to your device.
Enjoy seamless digital borrowing—no late fees, no waiting in line.
Stay ahead with online courses and certifications from LinkedIn Learning.
Access global news and top magazines in one convenient place.
access.paragraph2: Join thousands of digital explorers, get your EPL card today!

customerStories.heading: Customer Stories
customerStories.quote: I am really happy that the EPL plays such a big role in the community. People of all ages and walks of life are welcome at the Library. Thank you for the wonderful staff and all that they do! Thanks for the Makerspace, art, music and lectures.
customerStories.author: A. Arntzen

whyGetEPLCard.heading: Why Get an EPL Card?
whyGetEPLCard.paragraph: An EPL card gives you the freedom to access premium content without the price tag. Whether you’re a digital creator, freelancer, or just love to try new things, EPL has what you need to stay connected.

card1.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card1.content: Stream quality films, documentaries, and shows anytime, anywhere. Kanopy gives you on-demand access to stories that entertain, educate, and inspire. It’s a perfect way to stay connected and entertained.

card2.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card2.content: Stay up to date with thousands of newspapers and magazines from around the world. Whether you're looking for the latest headlines or your favourite lifestyle reads, PressReader has you covered.

card3.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card3.content: Borrow eBooks and audiobooks anytime with Libby by OverDrive, the library reading app. Whether you're on the go or winding down at home, enjoy stories delivered straight to your device.

card4.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card4.content: Shape the future of digital reading with The Palace Project App! Access eBooks and eAudiobooks from Libby and Audible, all in one place.

questions.title: What do I need to get a library card?
questions.text:
Getting your EPL card is simple. Visit any EPL location with identification (Drivers’ License, Alberta Health Care Card, etc.) and proof of Edmonton address in hand or signup online for a 45-day temporary card to start experiencing some of the benefits of EPL membership before visiting a branch to get a full membership.
If you're under 18, your parent or guardian must sign for you, and they'll be responsible for what you borrow.

questions.title: Do I need a library card to access the eBooks and online resources?
questions.text: We license our digital content from a number of companies (library vendors). The vendors require us to only allow our customers to access their products. For most products we are only licensed for the citizens of Edmonton. Your library card confirms your identity for the library vendors websites.

questions.title: Do University and College Students qualify for library cards?
questions.text:
Yes, and Library cards are free for all Edmonton Residents! Some schools even allow you to use your student card as your EPL card! This is called an L-Pass.
  • U of A students and faculty - access EPL free with U of A L-Pass.
  • MacEwan University students, staff and faculty - access EPL free with MacEwan L-Pass.
  • Concordia University College students and faculty - access EPL free with Concordia L-Pass (does not work in IE8 or earlier).
  • Norquest students - access EPL free with Norquest L-Pass.
  • King's University students - register here with your King's University library card number and PIN.
